items.content_html: I Checked Lightroom CC when it came out and wasn‚Äôt too impressed. Back then I was using an iPhone SE. I downloaded it this weekend on my iPhone Xs and with the combination of new camera and improvements, it‚Äôs really a lot better.

Yes, I am a tastemaker: The Pen Addict 334

An episode even non-pen addicts may enjoy when Brad discusses his passion and realising his words can have an impact.
The whole ‚ÄúI‚Äôm passionate about the Oxford Comma‚Äù thing feels very cliche now. So my bio will have ‚ÄúNo.1 em dash fan‚Äù
I‚Äôm really enjoying playing with the iPhone XS camera. It lets me take photos I couldn‚Äôt with the SE. Shot with Slow Shutter Cam
TWSBI ECO in trans green and Blossom Red for Christmas The green looks pretty cool.
Colder weather means porter time. This is a Christmas porter.
Pocketcasts 7. Great update.
Any wireless charging recommendations for iPhone Xs? I‚Äôm looking at the Anker PowerPort 5, The Logitech Powered for iPhone looks the best‚Ä¶but that price.

‚ÄúBeing creative is not so much the desire to do something as the listening to that which wants to be done: The dictation of the materials‚Äù -Anni Alberts ‚ÄúWeaving in a college‚Äù via Austin Kleon‚Äôs Blog ‚ÄúThe Dictation of the Materials‚Äù

Read the whole thing, you won‚Äôt regret it.
Finally got my iPhone XS in a semi set state. Still moving a couple of items around by this is my homescreen for now. Might add this to my now page ü§î
It‚Äôs a public holiday here in Poland so I took my daughter down to the graduation tower connected to Wieliczka salt mine.
In addition to Veterans Day and Armistice day, November 11 is Polish Independence Day. Prior to the end of the First World War, Poland had faced 123 years under foreign rule.
Morning coffee in krakow. The sign says ‚Äúcoffee is essential‚Äù
Morning Music üéµ L.I.F.EG.O.E.S.O.N by Noah And The Whale

Good News: National Witness? | Fulcrum Anglican

Good liturgy isn‚Äôt everything, but bad liturgy isn‚Äôt anything.

Tom Wright on the state of modern evangelical worship.

items.title: Where are the fresh blogging opinions üîó
items.content_html:
Daring Fireball: Dan Frakes Goes to Apple as Mac App Store Editor

Cross linking between blogs has nearly dried up. It‚Äôs almost impossible to find new opinions because everyone links to the same three websites, like I‚Äôm doing now.

A lot of voices have moved on to podcasting. Frankly, as someone that also podcasts, it‚Äôs easier and there‚Äôs less accountability than with blogging. Today, I also see a lot of thoughtful people writing on Discord groups. There‚Äôs little value in blogging unless you just like to practice writing in public.

This is one of those articles that starts discussing one issue, but the commentary actually is far more interesting than the inital discussion (In my opinion at least). I wonder how accurate Gabe‚Äôs prognosis is (that new voices are podcasting). While I see truth in this, I also think one of the issues is that online writing has become quite formulaic and people simply copy others ideas without offering something fresh. No one could be a full time blogger in the early days of online writing, now there are a host of them (and companies that employ writers) who‚Äôs opinions are well regarded. I‚Äôve started (and stopped) following some new writers as I realised they were just repeating others points. At the same time, I have discovered fresh voices who offer something unique.

  • Rose Orchard
  • Denny Henke
  • Zsolt Benke
  • Greg Morris
  • Andy Nicolaides Admittedly some of those same voices also use their litteral voices for podcasts too, but that doesn‚Äôt stop the fact that they are adding their unique writing voice. Really, it‚Äôs not that writing is in decline, it‚Äôs that more writers are also professional podcasters.

items.title: Austin Mann on the New iPad Pro üîó
items.content_html: the new ipad pro for photographers Austin is great to follow for all things Apple and photography and his latest post doesn‚Äôt disappoint. He really picks up on the key issues I‚Äôve faced with editing photos on iOS as well as some of the work arounds‚Ä¶which kind of work. I‚Äôm going to check out the Gnarbox.

Spark Email showing me a new feature with a dismiss button of ‚ÄúThank You‚Äù I‚Äôm both impressed at the clever copy hack of getting people to say thank you to build connection and annoyed that I‚Äôm being forced to say thank you.
Can‚Äôt wait to dig into the new procreate update :)
I missed my train at krakow station last night. So I finally returned to street photography with my iPhone.

I‚Äôm becoming increasingly critical of the IPad as a platform. Not because it‚Äôs getting worse but because it‚Äôs got so good. There are so few things that now hold it back, those that do become increasingly frustrating.

items.title: No one makes a living on Pateron üîó
items.content_html:
No one makes a living on Patreon

Of those creators, only 1,393 ‚Äî 2 percent ‚Äî make the equivalent of federal minimum wage of $7.25 an hour, or $1,160 a month, in October 2017. Worse, if we change it to $15 per hour, a minimum wage slowly being adopted by states, that‚Äôs only .8 percent of all creators.

Kind of depressing reading as it casts a lot of doubt on pateron and donations as long term viable income streams. At the same time, it‚Äôs not the most suprising statistic and seems to refect common distribution curves where the top far out performs the majority.
Monday Morning Music üéµAthlete: Half Life
Ulysses keyboard shortcuts for Mac and iOS I love how many different shortcuts Ulysses has‚Ä¶except I have trouble remembering all of them .
‚ÄúChanges that seem small and unimportant at first will compound into remarkable results if you stick with them for years.‚Äù ‚Äî James Clear in Atomic Habits
